did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Jack Shoemaker Papers,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Jack Shoemaker Papers, M710, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHY
bioghist.p: Book publisher, editor, and one-time seller (the bookstore/press Sand Dollar Books was a Shoemaker venture) Jack Shoemaker has participated in and made great contribution to virtually every facet of the publishing industry. With William Turnbull, he founded the venerable North Point Press in Berkeley, which published 365 books in its 12-year life span. When North Point closed in 1991, Shoemaker moved to Pantheon Books, where he served as West Coast Editor and developed the manuscripts which make up the bulk of this collection. In 1994 he left the Bay Area for Washington, D.C., where he is editor-in-chief at Counterpoint, a literary publisher whose authors include MFK Fisher, Gary Snyder, and Wendell Berry, whose editorial association with Shoemaker spans his tenure at North Point and Pantheon.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: Jack Shoemaker's professional and literary archives represent a variety of personal and professional interests, including a number of unpublished or shelved manuscripts whose provenance is unclear. For this reason, the archive has been subdivided into a number of smaller series, usually organized alphabetically.

did.unittitle: SERIES I: Professional: Pantheon Client Documents

scopecontent.p: Contains mainly art, sales, marketing, and editorial correspondence concerning Shoemaker's clients at Pantheon West

did.unittitle: SERIES II: Pantheon Correspondence and Subject Files

scopecontent.p: General topics and correspondence from the years 1991-4, when Shoemaker worked for Pantheon.

did.unittitle: SERIES III: Production and Promotion

scopecontent.p: A collection of documents detailing more general production and development issues

did.unittitle: SERIES IV: Publishers (Incl. Pantheon non-list business)

scopecontent.p: Contains general information about other publishing houses, as well as Pantheon's non-list business.

did.unittitle: SERIES V: Personal Projects and Subject Files

scopecontent.p: The difference between "personal subject files" and "unpublished manuscripts" comes down to size and to level of perceived professional interest: some of the books in the unpublished MSS category had been under contract with North Point Press before it closed and the contracts were nullified when Pantheon chose not to take on the editing; some MSS were under discussion at Pantheon or North Point and ultimately shelved; some are large and unwieldy manuscripts without correspondence to indicate whether the manuscript was retained for its personal interest to Shoemaker himself or for possible publication.

did.unittitle: SERIES VI: Unpublished Manuscripts

scopecontent.p: The difference between "personal subject files" and "unpublished manuscripts" comes down to size and to level of perceived professional interest: some of the books in the unpublished MSS category had been under contract with North Point Press before it closed and the contracts were nullified when Pantheon chose not to take on the editing; some MSS were under discussion at Pantheon or North Point and ultimately shelved; some are large and unwieldy manuscripts without correspondence to indicate whether the manuscript was retained for its personal interest to Shoemaker himself or for possible publication.

did.unittitle: SERIES VII: Pantheon Manuscripts

scopecontent.p: Consists of draft copies of the Pantheon West books themselves.

did.unittitle: SERIES VIII: Personal Collection

scopecontent.p: A very small series of bound materials which were found apart from the others, perhaps because they were last-minute additions to the archive: an undated address book, a two-volume source book from the 1993 "Art of the Wild" Conference, and proofs for two books published by Parallax Press whose main interest to Shoemaker seems to be personal--The Awakening of the West because of its link to the Zen practice and publishing with which Shoemaker is associated; and the Petra Kelly essays because of their concern with environmentalism.

did.unittitle: SERIES IX: Photos

scopecontent.p: The photo collection is arranged alphabetically by name, where subject is identifiable.
